thread.title: NOPD: Suspect in Tulane robbery newly arrested for other crimes
thread.title_full: NOPD: Suspect in Tulane robbery newly arrested for other crimes - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: Kelly Weston, Digital Content Producer
title: NOPD: Suspect in Tulane robbery newly arrested for other crimes
text:
NEW ORLEANS, LA (WVUE) - The man suspected of robbing three Tulane students on campus Oct. 10 has now been connected to two other robberies, according to New Orleans police.
Investigators said 20-year-old Tre Spadoni is a suspect in an Oct. 8 armed robbery in which a 19-year-old student was forced at gunpoint to walk to three separate ATMs to try to withdraw money. In that case, police said Spadoni got away with $300 of withdrawn cash, and a $100 gift card and $5 from the victimâ€™s wallet.
On Wednesday (Oct. 14) police said Spadoni was the gunman who held up a group of people in Mid-City. In that case, a gunman approached a group of four people near Cleveland and Lopez streets Wednesday just after 9 p.m. and demanded their property.
Spadoni now faces several charges, including armed robbery, false imprisonment with a weapon, aggravated assault with a firearm, attempted armed robbery and carrying a weapon on school property.
